question: The Financial Action Task Force is an inter-governmental body. What is the main purpose of this Task Force?
option1: To combat money laundering and terrorist financing
option2: combat the maleffects of Global Meltdown
option3: combat the problems of Least Development Countries LDCs
answer: To combat money laundering and terrorist financing
explanation: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) is an inter-governmental policymaking body that has a ministerial mandate to establish international standards for combating money laundering and terrorist financing.Â  India joined the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) as its 34th member in June 2010.
